# format

**Instance Property**

The format of the vertex attribute.

## Declaration

```swift
var format: MTLVertexFormat { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property specifies the data type of the vertex attribute that corresponds to an input argument of a shading language function. The [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat] may be converted to the data type in the shading function argument with the following specified limitations. Invalid type conversion causes a compilation error.

Conversion of vectors of different lengths is valid. The length of vectors can be reduced. For example,  [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/int4] data can be reduced to a single `int` shader argument is valid, and the last three values of the vector are discarded. Vectors can also be expanded; for example, expanding [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/int] to an `int4` vector shader argument is valid. When expanding, the extra components are filled with the corresponding components of (0,0,0,1).

The sign of an integer [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat] can not be cast to a shader argument with an integer type of a different sign. For example, casting the signed format [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/int] to an `uint` shader argument is invalid. Casting [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/uint] to an `int` argument is also invalid.

Integer truncation is not supported. For example, casting the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/int] to a `short` is invalid. However, casting [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/short2] to a vector of `int` values is valid.

Casting any [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat] to a `float` or `half` is valid. Casting normalized [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat] types (such as [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexFormat/short2Normalized]) are only valid to `float` or `half`.

## Organizing the vertex attribute

- **offset**: The location of an attribute in vertex data, determined by the byte offset from the start of the vertex data.
- **bufferIndex**: The index in the argument table for the associated vertex buffer.
- **MTLVertexFormat**: Values that specify the organization of function vertex data.
